title: Gourmet pizza, great salads and super starters
text: Started off with calamari, meatballs and salads. So good. We ordered so we could do family style. The gnocchi was incredible! My fav. Pizzas were great. But I was almost full by the time pizza came! My son and his friends loved the place and the cool vibe. Great service.

title: Excellent steaks, sides and salads
text: I took my Gators for a great celebratory dinner. My college kids were excited for a great meal...and it certainly was! It started off with a choice of tasty bread slices. We had the incredible prime filet mignon flatbread. The porterhouse steaks were excellent. I was pleasantly surprised. Especially because I ate at a NYC steakhouse the night before and I thought the steak was just as good if not better. The buttery spinach was one of our favs, along with the lobster mashed potatoes. The truffle Mac was a little bland. But overall a great meal.

title: Delicious pizza and waffles! Awesome outdoor picnic tables.
text: Delicious deep pan pizza. Loved the squared crispy crust. The specialty pizzas were amazing (Motor City and Buffalo Bird). I took my college daughter and her girlfriends for dinner. Served in pizza boxes we asked for paper plates and sat in one of the many picnic tables. The pizza was devoured pretty quickly so we then ordered the buttery waffles. So good! Such a fun, flavorful and a carb-full meal!

title: Casual and colorful style
text: I almost felt like I was going into a college apartment building with the pool tables in the lobby. Causal and colorful chairs and tables. Young vibe. It could use a little cleaning. Rafael at the front desk was very helpful. Convenient location to campus & 34th Street.

title: Charming tavern with delicious dishes
text: When you walk into the restaurant it has a charming warm decor. Plexiglass divides each table. We were served humus and thick toasted bread right away. The Greek salad was solid with onions, small cucumbers and even a few capers. The grilled octopus appetizer was delicious. The seafood medley with orzo & feta was excellent and hearty. Only wish our waiter was better. He never checked on us. I had to recruit another sweet waitress to fill our waters and clear our plates.

title: Swordfish and shrimp delight
text: A charming and delightful little restaurant on the main road in Dorado. Our waiter was so hospitable. We enjoyed our Italian meal very much.

title: Dorado delight
text: I haven’t been to this property in 20 years. They did a beautiful job renovating and refurbishing the rooms and lobby. Very modern tropic. Best part is the beach! I love the alcove and the privacy of just our hotel. It took me a day to adjust to the decrepit building next door that they are demolishing. I stayed in my zone and appreciated the Hyatt property. The staff was incredibly helpful. Special shout out to Natasha R. And Nancy P. At the front desk. They were charming and hospitable. We met the GM, Gabriel, who was very welcoming.
place: Hyatt Residence Club Dorado, Hacienda del Mar

title: The delicious taste of Greece in Gramercy
text: Having gone to Greece last year before COVid , I loved the vibe of white decor with splashes of blue. This charming corner restaurant family owned and run was a lovely and flavorful experience. Our traditional Greek parties were delectable and the lamb was soft and tasty. Highly recommend this upscale spot.

title: Amazing Italian food and flavor
text: We enjoyed a fabulous family dinner starting off with a pitcher of sangria, truffle ravioli (insane!) and seafood medley. The chicken parm was perfect. The shrimp scampi was delish. Our waitress, Jordan, was terrific! She made our dinner experience even better! We will be back!

title: Best burger and bone!
text: My husband tried for weeks to get a reservation. We got one at 5pm! We took it. We had the place pretty much to ourselves inside. Our college age son was in heaven with the amazing burgers! We loved both the Black label burger and the Minetta burger. Probably one of our top 3 burgers we have ever had. So soft and juicy. The bone marrow was smooth and tasty. I’d never had it before, and truly enjoyed it. The spinach was a surprise side. Our waiter was excellent, Tony from Croatia, he was part of the amazing dining experience. Guillermo from Mexico, did a terrific job too. We will definitely be back.

title: Good food but missed the mark on service
text: We took our college aged children for a great steakhouse. We had heard good things about Keens. We had a nice table inside by the wall with plexiglass dividing us from other patrons. Our waiter started off strong, but became non-existent and uninterested. Which changes the dining experience (hence, 3 stars). Our terrific bus boy, Alex from Mexico, was charming and improved our night. Getting to the food....The bacon was fatty and delicious, the crab cakes were delectable. The bread basket was average, but the carrots and celery plate with blue cheese was a nice and tasty opener. Of course we had the mutton chop, which was tasty and warm. Our porterhouse came out cold. So we kindly asked for them to heat it up. Once warmed our filet was delicious. But that’s when our waiter became nonexistent. We ended up ordering our cheesecake with Alex, because he was the one checking on us. It shows you that you can have a great steak, but you have to have equally great service to create the ideal experience.

title: Our favorite find and meal of the week!
text: Don't miss this downstairs restaurant with great western decorative styling! The food was excellent, the pastas were fresh and properly cooked and fabulously seasoned. The salads were tasty and the fresh bread was delicious. Our server was charming and helpful. We will definitely go back on our next trip to Aspen.

title: Gnocchi, nutella and Nirvana!
text: Located in the heart of restaurant row on Hopkins Ave, this charming and stylish restaurant had a whimsical and fun European flair. We ate inside at a high top booth in the corner. We started with the incredible truffle gnocchi, which was the highlight of the meal. We had the Nirvana crepe for dinner, which had a nice curry taste. The foie gras wasn't what we excepted or liked, and our sweet waitress returned it back to the kitchen. It was a lovely, lively and delicious night.
place: French Alpine Bistro - Creperie du Village

title: Best Brunch at the Bear
text: Cool chic vibe for brunch. We had the corner table outside on a gorgeous day. We had the decadent French toast, fried eggs with bacon on an oversized English muffin, granola and fruit. Everything was excellent! I asked a local where to go for bfast and she told me about this new restaurant that opened in February.

title: Bursts of meaty flavor
text: We wanted some good NY pastrami...well we found it! I had the open pastrami sandwich which came with coleslaw and potato salad...my hubby had the regular sandwich. We were savoring every bite! Highly recommend!

title: Flavorful, fun and creative food!
text: We enjoyed this bustling little corner Thai restaurant on 2nd Ave. on the Upper East Side. We researched and knew to order the volcano chicken, which was amazing and the drunken noodles, which was delicious! The service, from the hosts to the servers, to our sweet waitress, was excellent. Highly recommend!

title: Smooth yogurt with a big flavor
text: We were greeted by a big hello when we arrived in this cute little place in West Village. Decided on the blueberry almond and chocolate flavors. So creamy good. They use real Greek yogurt. With real chocolate chip cookies pieces, more like chunks, for our topping...score! Would definitely go back!

title: Average Mediterranean food. Solid B-
text: We live part time around the corner of this new Turkish restaurant. The outside tables were lovely. The humus was surprisingly bland, so was the Greek salad. The branzinni was delicious and came with another salad. Our waiter should have suggested something else besides the Greek salad that we ordered. It was a lot of salad. Service was nice. Just not a memorable or special meal.

title: Yummy in your tummy!
text: I could skip dinner and just eat these cookies! We had a few different flavors and they were all amazing. It's a must if you go to Breck and Main Street. There is usually a line, which is well deserved. Worth the wait and the price. But it might not be worth it for the tummy if you eat too many ;)

title: Good local pizzeria
text: I had the Cobb salad, which was good. Bacon was hard, but the rest of the ingredients were fine. Went for the pizza, which was solid. It's not NY pizza, but they do a nice job. Crust is a little thick (versus NY pizza which is thinner). Our waiter was super friendly and made it a positive experience.

title: Super salads and great nachos
text: Eric's is a great staple on Main Street. Good vibe inside, our waitress was sweet and helpful. Started with chicken nachos, which were surprisingly good. Along with the hot pretzels (definitely recommend!). A few of us had the enormous salads, which were very filling and flavorful. Burgers were great.

title: Summer burgers on Main Street
text: It was fun eating at the tables on the street since they closed down Main Street to traffic for the summer and Covid. Fun to people watch as we ate delicious burgers. I loved my my Green Eggs and Ham burger. My guys were a little more picky with their burgers. Truffle fries were decent. The dessert shakes are a must!! So decadent.

title: Flavorful and fun
text: We walked across from our hotel to this great Mexican restaurant. We sat by the window with a wonderful view of the creek. Kevin was a great waiter who brought us a terrific tray of salsas and chips...always a good way to start! I had the duck with mango quesadilla which was a symphony of great tastes. My husband had fajitas with well seasoned green peppers and onions. Our young adult sons had massive burritos which they enjoyed and devoured. Highly recommend Mi Casa.

title: Sold at Bold!
text: We were sold on this charming restaurant right by our hotel at the Hyatt Main Street Station. Terrific breakfasts, we had Greek omelets and our son had a egg burrito. We had lunch here too. Terrific burgers! Some of the best we had in town. And for the summer it was only $10 during their lunch special. Great service by Laura, who was charming and attentive. Plus the outside seating is refreshing.

title: Great back patio, good food
text: We enjoyed a late summer dinner on the back patio with the recommended shrimp and bacon appetizer- very good. I had the red trout which had such a terrific flavor. My sons had burgers and burritos which were to their satisfaction. A good solid meal.

title: Pho Good! So Good!
text: We wanted something different to eat after eating a lot of burgers in Breck. Saw the great reviews for Pho on Main. It was a charming little place upstairs on Main. We sat outside for dinner and had Saki, dumplings and steamed rolls to start. Then the amazing, huge, delicious soup bowls arrived! My husband and I had chicken and shrimp and our young adult sons had the brisket and beef with Pho noodles. Great and quick service was a plus with hungry boys! One of our favorite meals in Breck!

title: Located close to Wall Street
text: Located close to Wall Street with a downstairs entrance. Our investment banker son had heard good things about Harry’s. So we went last night with him and had a delicious meal. I had the amazing branzino fish and the guys had the fantastic Wagyu burgers (they were rated very high). Service was excellent (we liked how they cleared all the plates at the same time too). Enjoyable evening.

title: Scrumptious sushi and stellar service!
text: I’ve been going to Bluefin for over a decade and the food has always been fabulously fresh & flavorful. The service is always fantastic. Tim is the best manager, he always greets you with a warm welcome. Birthdays are fun to celebrate here. I love this place! A Parkland sushi gem!

title: Blissful biscuits and cheerful vibe
text: I loved walking up to the restaurant and seeing the colorful outside booths. A very fun vibe. The menu was creative with plenty of selections. I loved my smoked salmon with eggs. We shared a red velvet pancake that was terrific. We would definitely go back!

title: Delicious and decadent meal
text: Beautiful venue with an impressive balcony level. We ate upstairs which made it nice for dining and conversation. Our waiter was charming and the food was excellent. We go often to NY steakhouses and wanted to try Benjamin’s. It didn’t disappoint. We all agreed it was a delicious and decadent meal.

title: Creative rolls and cool vibe
text: A cute trendy Asian place with fun and funky sushi rolls. The waitresses were very attentive. Our first visit, but we’ll definitely be back.

title: Scenic splendor!
text: This was my second time taking this spectacular trail along the river. My husband and I used the new electric bikes from Aspen to Basalt (we used more power/battery on the way back!) The views, the water, the mountains, the plains are all breathtaking. This trail is a must!

title: Steak, cake and bake!
text: My second visit to Maestro’s was another scrumptious meal! We started off with the baked king crab truffle gnocchi - out of this world! A must. The steak is like butter, it just melts in your mouth. Which brings me to the butter cake which is insane! One of my favorite steakhouses in NYC! Service was superb as usual (thanks Ronnie!).

title: Fun, flavorful and filling
text: We came specifically for the food. We weren’t seeing a show so it was kind of a busy, fun atmosphere. Caesar salad, chicken parm, stuffed clams and the traditional other dishes were delicious. We had sangria for the table which was perfect for our table of 7. The cheesecake was also a huge portion and was soft and creamy. Great dining experience.

title: Mexican flair breakfast
text: Heard good things about this new restaurant. We went for breakfast and had a delicious meal! I had the fried eggs over a tostado with guacamole and arugula. Yum. My husband had flavorful eggs and meat soft tacos. Our table shared the brioche toast with fruit which was amazing ( it was like a thick French toast). It was one of our favorite breakfasts on our visit.

title: Solid & seasoned breakfast place
text:
A good & small casual diner with a great selection of omelets, pancakes and more.
A popular place with a homey feel.

title: Best place to stay in Aspen!
text: Great location in the middle of town at the bottom of the Aspen mtn. Rooms are huge, clean and very upscale. The staff is excellent. The concierge, Sherry, is very helpful. Vic, the resort manager is terrific!! We have been to this property many times and appreciate Vic’s friendly greeting and consistency of service over the years.

title: Love the Rocky Mountain rocks!
text: Huge stones with John Denver’s lyrics inscribed on them scattered throughout this open air rock garden next to the river. So scenic. Stay and reflect or take a few pics and go.

title: Rise and shine!
text: Cute place on the corner with big windows & the sun shining in. Order at the counter. Great choices for bfast! Açaí bowls, avocado toast, smoothies, fresh omelets and more. Friendly staff. Started our day off strong with a hearty meal.

title: Great vibe, good food
text: We got lucky and didn’t have to wait for a table due to it being off season. I had the Thai steak noodle dish. It was tasty with a few pieces of steak, and had a bit too much dressing. My friend had the Macho salad, which included mixed greens...but it was more of a kale salad (which he doesn’t like). I’m glad we went to see what the fuss was all about. Lots of great energy even in a very quiet off season town.

title: The Cheers of Aspen
text:
You can tell they know all the locals by name. Casual and comforting inside. Good burgers,
nice veggie dish and solid salads. An Aspen original.

title: Panorama paradise!
text: The views from the trail are amazing with majestic backdrops for incredible pics! A great hike with a few moderate inclines. A must for anyone visiting Aspen.

title: Nice Italian menu with nice decor.
text: We enjoyed a nice causal dinner at this delightful restaurant. Pizza was good, and the seafood entrees were fresh and tasty. Amazing chocolate bread pudding.

title: Terrific terrace and friendly waiter.
text: The Moussaka & Greek salad were delicious! But it was the incredible view on the cute deck that made it a 10! One of our most memorable meals in Greece.

title: Exciting and amazing!
text: The views, the ancient structures, the location are all fantastic! Not crowded in September and we were able to get some fabulous pictures. It’s in the heart of the city. So special to see it illuminated at night.

title: Fabulous & fresh!
text: We loved the outside corner vibe at this very popular place. Our seafood dishes, salmon and snapper, were delectable and plentiful. Great host and seasoned waiter. One of our favorites restaurants in Athens.

title: Meet & squeeze ;)
text: Cute place with tables very close to each other inside (hence the squeeze). We had the eponymous “meat & cheese” board. Nice little sampling of 3 delectable meats and 3 tasty cheeses. Flavorful lamb tacos were offered that day, which we loved. They also have great salads and sandwiches.

title: Upstairs NY vibe in CO
text: You order at the counter. Lots of pizza choices. Cash only, and agree they need to wash their hands after touching the money and handling the pizza. We took two huge cheese slices cause it came fresh from the spatula. We had a nice big antipasto salad. It’s a staple in Aspen.

title: Terrific Surf & Turf
text: A few friends recommended Clark’s. Great energy inside. The waitress super friendly. Fantastic burger w/ shoestring fries. Our seafood dish, cioppino, was tasty and filling with a slab of delectable bread to dip in the flavorful broth.

title: Flavorful and creative menu
text: Highly recommend. Loved my carpaccio, a nice portion with tasty toppings. My carrot gnocchi was a delectable dish with roasted root veggies. Our friend had a great burger that he was still talking about the next day.

title: Our daily delight!
text: On our occasional visits to Aspen, Paradise Bakery is our go to place for the best cookies, muffins and more! We have fun picking something different & delicious every day of our visit. A must go!
